author: plasmapower
content: A cross rollup tx is just a L2->L1 message + a L1->L2 message for the other rollup. So you should just need censorship resistance for each individual component, e.g. forced txs from L1 that can do a withdrawal.

author: plasmapower
content: and arbitrum delayed messages are fully general, so you can do as complex of an L2 tx you want without the sequencer being able to censor

author: kelemeno
content: Thank you, I meant direct L2->L2 transactions as described here: https://wiki.polygon.technology/docs/zkEVM/lx-ly-bridge, or here: https://blog.matter-labs.io/zksync-l3-pathfinder-to-hit-testnet-in-q1-2023-367a425592db . As I understand these do not go through L1, however they need to go through the receiving L2's sequencer  mechanism, so in this sense they are worse than forced txs.

author: kelemeno
content: As I understand these are unfortunately less suited for ORs
